about.summary: Estimates exponential-family random graph models for multilevel network data, assuming the multilevel structure is observed. The scope, at present, covers multilevel models where the set of nodes is nested within known blocks. The estimation method uses Monte-Carlo maximum likelihood estimation (MCMLE) methods to estimate a variety of canonical or curved exponential family models for binary random graphs. MCMLE methods for curved exponential-family random graph models can be found in Hunter and Handcock (2006) <DOI: 10.1198/106186006X133069>. The package supports parallel computing, and provides methods for assessing goodness-of-fit of models and visualization of networks.

Estimates exponential-family random graph models for multilevel network data, assuming the multilevel structure is observed. The scope, at present, covers multilevel models where the set of nodes is nested within known blocks. The estimation method uses Monte-Carlo maximum likelihood estimation (MCMLE) methods to estimate a variety of canonical or curved exponential family models for binary random graphs. MCMLE methods for curved exponential-family random graph models can be found in Hunter and Handcock (2006) <DOI: 10.1198/106186006X133069>. The package supports parallel computing, and provides methods for assessing goodness-of-fit of models and visualization of networks.

name: r-mlergm
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.8.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-mlergm
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/mlergm_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/mlergm/mlergm_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: ec3422a4288ed3b9b2a951dd067c6853bad288b82254a16cb84e0857f60e0366

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ggally
    - r-matrix
    - r-cowplot
    - r-ergm >=3.10.1
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-lpsolve
    - r-network >=1.15
    - r-plyr
    - r-reshape2
    - r-sna >=2.4
    - r-stringr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ggally
    - r-matrix
    - r-cowplot
    - r-ergm >=3.10.1
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-lpsolve
    - r-network >=1.15
    - r-plyr
    - r-reshape2
    - r-sna >=2.4
    - r-stringr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('mlergm')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('mlergm')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=mlergm
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: 'Estimates exponential-family random graph models for multilevel network data, assuming the multilevel structure is observed. The scope, at present, covers multilevel models where the set of nodes is nested within known blocks. The estimation method uses Monte-Carlo maximum likelihood estimation (MCMLE) methods
    to estimate a variety of canonical or curved exponential family models for binary random graphs. MCMLE methods for curved exponential-family random graph models can be found in Hunter and Handcock (2006) <DOI: 10.1198/106186006X133069>. The package supports parallel computing, and provides methods for assessing goodness-of-fit
    of models and visualization of networks.'
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - izahn
